articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Shooting Contest of Participants in KPA Meeting
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Shooting Contest of Participants in KPA Meeting
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and  first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, guided the shooting contest of the participants in the 4th meeting of the company commanders and political instructors of the KPA.
					 Acknowledging the enthusiastic cheers of all participants, he said he was very pleased to meet again the company commanders and political instructors whom he wished to see every day.
					
					 Noting that the KPA is holding the shooting contest unprecedented in the history of army building with all company commanders and political instructors of the whole army attending, he referred to the objective of the contest.
					
					 Servicepersons cannot satisfactorily fulfill their combat duties when they are not good at shooting even if they are prepared well politico-ideologically and physically, he said, adding that only when company commanders and political instructors become good marksmen, can they train their soldiers to be crack shots never missing targets.
					
					 He noted this shooting contest was organized to make the torch of the movement for becoming crack shots and master gunners rage more furiously in the whole army. 
					
					 The contest was participated in by company commanders and political instructors selected from the participants of the KPA meeting. It was held by the method of deciding on standing of services of the army, army corps level and that of individuals according to the points they gained by hitting targets in the given distance and within the given time.
					
					 The contesters demonstrated their marksmanship they cultivated in their day-to-day trainings.
					
					 Kim Jong Un clapped his hands, his face beaming with a broad smile, whenever the contesters got high points by accurately hitting targets.
					
					 At the shooting contest KPA Unit 233 and KPA Unit 604 won the first place and the KPA Navy, KPA Unit 287 and KPA Unit 318 placed second and KPA Unit 549 and KPA Unit 569 came third.
					
					 In the individual event Ri Yong Chol, company political instructor under KPA Unit 380, company political instructor Kang Un Chol and company commander Pak In Suk under KPA Unit 604 came first, Ri Sang Chol, company commander under KPA Unit 488, placed second and  Jon Yong Gol, company political instructor under KPA Unit 313, Ri Kwang Hyok, company commander under KPA Unit 233, Sung Myong Sim, company commander under KPA Unit 549, Kim Kwang Hyon, company commander under KPA Unit 593, and Han Ok Ju, company commander under KPA Unit 287, placed third.
					
					 A prize awarding ceremony took place at the end of the contest.
					
					 Kim Jong Un said that this shooting contest offered the company commanders and political instructors an opportunity to keenly realize that only when they become crack shots themselves, can they train all soldiers to be crack shots and master gunners, indicating tasks to be carried out to intensify shooting drills and ways to do so.
					
					 Among the spectators were KPA Vice Marshal Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, KPA General Ri Yong Gil, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA General Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, and other commanding officers of armed forces organs and company commanders and political instructors who participated in the 4th meeting of KPA company commanders and political instructors.

articles.title: Mongolian President Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Mongolian President Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, sacred temple of Juche, on Tuesday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Among the visitors were the Mongolian president's wife, Luvsanvandan Bold, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, Khaltmaa Battulga, minister of Industry and Agriculture, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, secretary general of the National Security Council, Tserendejid Byambajav, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, Khabshai Erjan, vice-minister of Road Transport, Lundeg Purevsuren, national security and foreign policy advisor to the President, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, advisor for mass liaison and mass policy to the President, Pureb Altangerel, secretary of state for the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, other officials concerned and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					 Accompanying the Mongolian president were Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, Hong Kyu, DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and officials concerned.
					
					 The guards of honor of the Ground Force, Navy and Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards lined up before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A floral basket was laid before the statues in the name of the Mongolian president.
					
					 He paid tribute to the statues.
					
					 He entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them who made an immortal contribution to the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Mongolia and the cause of global independence.
					
					 He went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The Mongolian president made an entry in the visitor's book.
					
					 He wrote:
					
					 The state, government and people of Mongolia highly appreciate the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the great leaders of the Korean people, who made valuable contributions to the development of the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries, provided the foundation of the relations and strengthened them. I am firmly convinced that the Korean people would reunify the country in a peaceful way and successfully realize the tasks for the prosperity of the country and improvement of the people's standard of living under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of the great leaders.

articles.title: Mongolian President Visits Panmunjom
articles.content:
Mongolian President Visits Panmunjom 
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Mongolian President Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj and his party visited Panmunjom in the DPRK on Tuesday. 
					 They visited the monument to President Kim Il Sung's signature. Kim Il Sung signed a historic document calling for ending the tragedy of national division and achieving national reunification during the last moments of his life. The monument conveys his patriotic intention. 
					
					 The guests went round the armistice talks room, the hall where the armistice agreement was signed and Panmun Pavilion, being briefed on the fact that the army and people of the DPRK repelled the invasion by the imperialist allied forces and won the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War under the wise guidance of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The guests also visited the Mausoleum of King Kongmin. 
					
					 They were invited to a reception hosted by the Kaesong City People's Committee on the same day. 
					
					 Earlier, the Mongolian president made a speech at the gathering of Mongolian businessmen and economic officials of the DPRK at Yanggakdo International Hotel.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a congratulatory message from Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on October 10.
					 The President said in his message that he was pleased to extend heartfelt and warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and people of the friendly DPRK on behalf of the state and people of Palestine and on his own behalf on the occasion of the anniversary of the friendly Workers' Party of Korea. He wished Kim Jong Un and the DPRK people greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 On this important occasion we express deep thanks to you for sending support and solidarity to the Palestinian people in their just struggle to achieve the right to self-determination, the building of an independent state and fair peace desired by all people of the region, the message noted. 
					
					 We wish you good health and happiness and steady development of the historic friendly relations between the two peoples, it added.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Leaves for Mexico, Brazil
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Leaves for Mexico, Brazil
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) headed by Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, left here Tuesday to visit Mexico and attend the 13th Congress of the Brazilian Communist Party to be held in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

articles.title: DWUK Delegation Leaves for Brazil
articles.content:
DWUK Delegation Leaves for Brazil
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) headed by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, left here Tuesday to take part in a meeting of the Secretariat of the Women's International Democratic Federation and an international seminar to be held in Brazil.

articles.title: DPRK Players Return from World Weightlifting Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Players Return from World Weightlifting Championship
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK players returned home on Tuesday after taking part in the 2013 World Weightlifting Championship held in Poland.
					 The championship brought together at least 310 weightlifters from 59 countries and regions of the world. DPRK player Om Yun Chol placed the first in a total point at the men's 56 kg category and other players bagged gold, silver and bronze medals.
					
					 The players were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Mun Kyong Dok, officials concerned and families of the players.
					
					 Sportspersons welcomed with bouquets and garlands the players and coaches who came back after displaying the honor of the country, and congratulated them on their successes.

articles.title: 24th National Software Contest, Exhibition Open
articles.content:
24th National Software Contest, Exhibition Open
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The 24th national software contest and exhibition were opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Tuesday.
					 Presented to the events are at least 1,200 programs developed by scientists and technicians.
					
					 Among them are process-controlling programs, devices and elements presented from various fields of the national economy including coal, power and metal industries, railway transport, agriculture and light industry.
					
					 Also presented there are many programs conducive to building a sports power.
					
					 They include achievements made by ministries, national institutions and industrial establishments in raising the level of IT use and programs presented by teachers, researchers and students of the universities, colleges and centers for training computer talents.
					
					 The contest and exhibition are divided into 18 panels including operating system and security, artificial intelligence and Korean language information handling panels. There will also take place contests of English-Korean and Chinese-Korean translation programs and simulation sports games programs.
					
					 Participating in the opening ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned and program developers.
					
					 Choe Sang Gon, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, made an opening speech.

articles.title: Reception Given at Czech Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given at Czech Embassy
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The embassy of the Czech Republic here gave a reception Tuesday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Czech Republic and its national day.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Myong Guk, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of foreign countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Dusan Strauch, ambassador of the Czech Republic to the DPRK, and his embassy officials were on hand.

articles.title: Performance Given by KPA Company Soldiers
articles.content:
Performance Given by KPA Company Soldiers
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A performance was given on Monday and Tuesday by soldiers of companies of the Korean People's Army who proved successful in the 36th Art Festival of KPA Servicepersons.
					 The participants in the 4th meeting of company commanders and political instructors of the KPA watched the performance.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as solo and chorus "Ode to the Motherland," dialogic poem "Care for Eternal Life" and dramatic story "Dangerous 'Mine'".
					
					 The performers impressively represented the pride and self-esteem of a-match-for-a-hundred fighters glorifying the new heyday of the powerful Paektusan revolutionary army under the care of the supreme commander and the might of the single-minded unity around him.
					
					 Small chorus "Good Is the Company Sideline Work", chorus "Hot Wind of Sports Is Nice" and other numbers deeply impressed the audience as they truthfully represented the worthwhile military service of the company soldiers.
					
					 The performers in interlude "Speed Preferred by the Marshal," chorus "July 27 March" and other numbers vividly reflected the ideological and moral traits of the KPA, which firmly defends the socialist motherland with arms and performs feats in every site for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Apple Sampling Contest Held
articles.content:
Apple Sampling Contest Held
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A contest of sampling apples produced at fruit farms across the country this year took place at the House for Farmer Visitors to Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il made sure that the contest of sampling apples was organized among fruit farms that turned into thriving orchards so as to boost the enthusiasm of producers.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un visited the Kosan Fruit Farm in June this year and indicated the tasks and ways for increasing the production of fruits at the large-scale fruit farm at the foot of Chol Pass, symbol of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The working people in the field of fruit farming planted many high-yielding fruit trees of good species and made positive efforts to manure and tend them as required by the Juche farming method.
					
					 Presented at the meeting were more than 30 species of apples picked at the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, fruit farms in Kwail County and the Kosan, Ryongjon and Toksong fruit farms.
					
					 The jury estimated sweetness, sour taste, flavor, juice content and hardness of apples of different species.

articles.title: Games of 30 Events of DPRK Championships End
articles.content:
Games of 30 Events of DPRK Championships End
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Games of more than 30 events of the DPRK Championships came to an end Tuesday.
					 The Amnokgang Sports Team came first and the April 25 Sports Team and the Sobaeksu Sports Team second and third in the men's volleyball event Tuesday.
					
					 The April 25 Sports Team placed first and the Sobaeksu Sports Team and the Pyongyang Sports Team second and third in the women's volleyball games.
					
					 In the men's and women's basketball games the April 25 Sports Team placed first and the Amnokgang Sports Team and the Kigwancha Sports Team second and third. 
					
					 The players of the April 25 Sports Team proved successful in the men's and women's table tennis games while players of the Amnokgang Sports Team came second and the men players of the Pyongyang Sports Team and the women players of the Rimyongsu Sports Team placed third.
					
					 In the weightlifting team event the men of Kigwancha Sports Team and the women of the April 25 Sports Team bested other players, the men of the April 25 Sports Team and women of the Pyongyang Sports Team placed second and the men and women of the Amnokgang Sports Team won the third place.
					
					 In the judo team games the men and women of the Amnokgang Sports Team won the title, the men of the Pyongyang Sports Team and the women of the April 25 Sports Team placed second, the men of the April 25 Sports Team and the Kuwolsan Sports Team and the women of the Pyongyang Sports Team and the Sports Team of Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry came third.
					
					 The April 25 Defense Sports Team proved successful in the men and women's team games in the shooting and archery events.
					
					 The men and women players of the Ryongnamsan Sports Team and the women players of the April 25 Sports Team excelled others in the handball event.
					
					 In gymnastic games the Pyongyang Sports Team and the April 25 Sports Team came on top in the men and women's events respectively.
					
					 Successes were also made in many other events including marathon, field and track, boxing, swimming and field hockey.

articles.title: 510 Dwelling Houses Built in Kosan Fruit Farm
articles.content:
510 Dwelling Houses Built in Kosan Fruit Farm
 Kosan, October 29 (KCNA) -- At least 510 dwelling houses were built in the Kosan Fruit Farm of Kangwon Province, the DPRK. The farm has turned into a large-scale fruit producer.
					 The houses with 2-3 living rooms, kitchen, washing room, store and pen will help the dwellers lead a happier life.
					
					 Members of the Construction Shock Brigade 618 set the aim to finish the construction of the houses in a short span of time and pushed forward the project.
					
					 The field headquarters properly distributed forces and scrupulously organized and commanded the project to simultaneously push forward the construction of dwelling houses in Puphyong, Ryangsa, Pongryon and other areas.
					
					 Shock brigade members actively introduced rational building methods and enhanced the speed of the project, while giving priority to the supply of raw materials. They ensured the quality of the buildings on a high level and arranged surroundings.
					
					 Those producing roofing tiles and slaked lime put the machines including mixers and molding machines in full capacity operation and produced building materials in good time.
					
					 Shock brigade members are stepping up the construction of dozens of public buildings in the same spirit with which they finished the construction of the dwelling houses.

articles.title: Yonthan Slate Mine Updated
articles.content:
Yonthan Slate Mine Updated
 Yonthan, October 29 (KCNA) -- The project for updating Yonthan Slate Mine in North Hwanghae Province was completed.
					 The slate production shop was newly built and stone processing equipment, an overhead crane, etc. were installed to mass-produce slate of various sizes.
					
					 The workers in the mine face-lifted the compound of the mine and the residential district by building dwellings, cultural hall, school, nursery, kindergarten and welfare and service facilities and planting trees of good species and creating lawn.
					
					 A ceremony took place on Tuesday to mark the completion of the project.
					
					 Present there were Kim In Sik, vice-premier, officials concerned and employees of the mine.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round the updated production processes.

articles.title: New Kind of Ozonizer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kind of Ozonizer Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Chemical Engineering Institute of the Hamhung Branch under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has developed a new kind of ozonizer which can produce highly-concentrated ozone.
					 For its strong sterilizing power, ozone is widely used in disinfecting kitchen utensils and medical instruments and treating digestive trouble and skin disease.
					
					 It is also applied to foodstuff and pharmaceutical industries, livestock farming, fish farming and other fields.
					
					 The new efficient device, based on discharge plasma technology, makes it possible to generate over 30 g of ozone per one cubic meter of air and more than 100 g of ozone per one cubic meter of oxygen.
					
					 It has already been introduced to several wading pools, foodstuff factories and hospitals, winning popularity.

articles.title: Kim Un Ju, DPRK's Weightlifter
articles.content:
Kim Un Ju, DPRK's Weightlifter
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Un Ju of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea finished first in the women's 75 kg category weightlifting in the 6th East Asian Games by snatching 113 kg and jerking 153 kg, 266 kg in total.
					 She distinguished herself in the World Weightlifting Championship and the Asian Weightlifting Championship held in 2011.
					
					 She clinched three gold medals in the 2013 Asian Cup and Interclub Junior and Senior Weightlifting Championship held in Pyongyang in September this year.
					
					 Active in the Kigwancha Sports Team, she renewed the national record seven times in local tournaments including the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games and the DPRK Championships.
					
					 As a winner of the title of the Merited Athlete, she was selected as one of the ten best sportspersons of the country in 2011. 
					
					 Beginning to learn weightlifting at her age of 11, she became an up-and-coming weightlifter two years later.
					
					 Choe Nong Gyun, her coach, told KCNA that she has already reached the world record in training.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Behave with Reason
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Behave with Reason
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities are working in real earnest to establish the national security council of Japan. 
					 The House of Representatives of Japan on Oct. 17 decided to set up an ad hoc committee for national security to deliberate on the bill for establishing the national security council, etc. and informally designated as its chairman the former minister of Finance from the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), who held the post of the director general of the Defense Agency in the past. 
					
					 Earlier, the chief executive of Japan, who called for building "strong Japan", expressed the will to establish the national security council and, at the same time, lay down a national security strategy. 
					
					 This is, in the final analysis, an extremely dangerous move of the present Japanese authorities as they are keen to round off the state machinery as befitting a war state. 
					
					 The national security council projected by Japan is just the same as the war mechanism of the U.S. as it is aggressive and bellicose in its nature.
					
					 As already known, the U.S. president is the chairman of the NSC which consists of the vice-president, the secretaries of State and Defense and the special assistant to the president for national security. 
					
					 In case the U.S. deems it necessary to launch a military attack and war against other countries, this institution is tasked to rapidly decide and handle the matters. 
					
					 Japan is now going to apply the U.S. method of deciding upon major policies to rapidly react to "contingency" and immediately launch a war of aggression according to the prime minister's resolution and intention. 
					
					 The national security strategy to be presented by the security council, in essence, does not exclude the aggressive nature under any circumstances. 
					
					 Japan recently adopted "active pacifism", a new self-portrait of Japan and a banner representing and leading Japan, as the main idea of the national security strategy. It is going to formally decide on it together with the "defence program guidelines" in December. 
					
					 The national security strategy is nothing but a document for a war of aggression which specifies as a strategy the "defence program guidelines" censured by the international community as an aggressive document for war and a declaration of war. From this point of view, it is not hard to guess what disasters it will bring to the world in the future. 
					
					 For Japan to round off the state machinery for aggression and adopt a war strategy is a reality on the horizon. 
					
					 The Japanese authorities at a meeting of the Japan-U.S. security consultative committee held in Tokyo early in October garnered the U.S. support for reexamination of the interpretation of the constitution for exercising the "right to collective self-defense", establishment of the national security council and increase of defense budget. 
					
					 On October 16 the meeting of experts of the Japanese government worked out even a proposal for studying actions for exercising the "right to collective self-defense" which specifies possible war actions of the Japanese armed forces. 
					
					 The LDP's dominance in the election of the House of Councilors provided the present Japanese government with a golden chance for speeding up the establishment of the national security council. 
					
					 Facts go to prove that Japan's moves for reinvasion have reached a graver phase.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' reckless moves to rapidly turn Japan into a war state are nothing but the fools' rash actions precipitating their self-destruction. 
					
					 The Japanese authorities are following in the footsteps of the past Japanese imperialists who met a miserable end after suffering a defeat in the war while rushing headlong into militarization. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to behave with reason, properly understanding that its moves for turning it into a military power and launching overseas aggression would lead to its miserable destruction

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams Political Chicanery in S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams Political Chicanery in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The "inspection of administration" by the Park Geun Hye's regime, the first one since she came to power, is now under way in south Korea. 
					 Being brought to light through the "inspection" are despicable political frauds and plots, the moves to revive "yusin" dictatorship and aspects of unpopular misrule by the Park Geun Hye group. 
					
					 There is increasing suspicion about the organized interference in the "presidential election" by the puppet Intelligence Service (IS) and the military cyber command, irrationality of the project of four large rivers, etc. 
					
					 It was disclosed that IS agents for psychological warfare released articles supporting and praising the "Saenuri Party" and candidate Park Geun Hye or opposing and slandering the Democratic Party and its candidates 55 689 times from Sept. 1 to Dec. 18 last year. 
					
					 It was proved that they used internet to fully interfere in the election and that the crimes disclosed so far are just a tip of the iceberg. 
					
					 During the election campaign Park often let loose "commitments" pleasant to the ear such as "era of people's happiness" and "economic recovery" but now she is in a desperate situation being called a "big liar". 
					
					 She promised to pay a certain amount of pensions to the elderly above 65 years of age every month. But this election commitment has nearly been breached. 
					
					 At that time the "Saenuri Party" trumpeted about implementing the commitments. But now it is citing the present conditions as an excuse, feigning ignorance of the promise. 
					
					 As a result, not only the commitment to pensions but more than 16 "commitments to public welfare" have been nullified. 
					
					 Now south Korea's economy dependent on outside forces has faced a serious crisis and people are left in the depths of distress. The jobless are everywhere in streets and the number of those committing suicide is on the steady increase, topping the world list. 
					
					 That's not all. Even before coming to power, the conservative group openly praised the crimes during the "yusin" era, saying that "'yusin in October' was an inevitable and the best option". As soon as taking office they went on the rampage to make south Korean society the dark land under fascist dictatorship. 
					
					 IS and other repressive bodies' political inspection and plot-breeding are being conducted in an open way. They indiscriminately launch campaigns to eliminate the "forces following the north" and trample down the progressive and democratic forces under the pretext of "plotted rebellion case". 
					
					 Despicable political swindling, plot-breeding and unpopular rule prevail in south Korea, the situation reminiscent of the era of "yusin" dictatorship in the past. 
					
					 South Korean opposition parties call the eight months of rule by the conservative group "eight frauds" and "eight worries". 
					
					 The eight months of Park Geun Hye's regime revealed the false nature of the conservative group. This is the expression of the mindset of the south Korean people. 
					
					 There is nothing to expect from the conservative group which prolongs its political life with frauds, plot-breeding and moves for the revival of "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls upon Officials to Devotedly Serve People
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls upon Officials to Devotedly Serve People
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Believing in people as in Heaven was the lifelong motto of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 If there is an almighty being in this world, it is not God but people and one should pluck even a star and bring a flower into bloom even on a rock if this is what they desire. This was the noble outlook on the people cherished by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They made endless journeys for field guidance for the happiness of the people all their lives, bearing this maxim in mind. 
					
					 Thanks to their ardent love for the country and its people and outlook on the people in which they regarded people as Heaven, their patriotic devotion to the people brought them joy and happiness and unfolded a legendary epic of love for the people. 
					
					 An official who regards the people as Heaven, enshrining their outlook on the people, can become a genuine servant of people, the person who works day and night and shoulders upon oneself heavier burden than any others for the improvement of the people's living standard. 
					
					 All the officials should devotedly work for the happiness of the people, true to the Workers' Party of Korea's politics of love for the people, and thus glorify their lives as genuine servants of the people, being called "our officials" by them, concludes the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms South Korea Colony of U.S.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms South Korea Colony of U.S.
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- South Korea is entirely dependent on the U.S. in all fields of politics, economy and military affairs, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The postponement of the "transfer of the right to command wartime operations", an acute political issue in south Korea, clearly suggests the wretched plight of the puppet forces as colonial stooges of the U.S. 
					
					 If one is subject to others politically, one cannot escape military subjugation and ever-deepening military subjugation is bound to increase the political dependence. 
					
					 The U.S. has all issues under its control, keeping south Korea under its military control. It is, therefore, natural for the U.S. to step up the interference in internal affairs and domination over south Korea, putting the puppet forces under strict political control.
					
					 The U.S. interference and backstage manipulation exercised strong influence on the appearance of the puppet regime, its shaping of policies and the whole course of their pursuance.
					
					 The present south Korean authorities are a group of stooges and the regime of servants who make south Korea totally dependent upon the U.S. politically, economically and militarily.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean regime is foolishly behaving like "an advanced state," unaware of how others view it. This provokes side-splitting laughter.
					
					 The puppet forces are busy making foreign trips to have talks with other countries and propose something. This is nothing but a cynical ploy to improve their image with the help of outside forces and bring under control the deplorable situation where they find themselves in an abyss of ruin, cursed and censured by people at home.
					
					 No matter how desperately the puppet forces may try to shake off the ill-fame as colonial stooges, they can never change their miserable position.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S., S. Korean Nuclear War Drumbeat against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts U.S., S. Korean Nuclear War Drumbeat against DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers have been busy staging war exercises codenamed "2013 Hoguk" across south Korea since October 24 under the pretext of coping with someone's "provocation of a local war" and "total war".
					 Involved in this saber-rattling which will last till November 1 are huge forces of the three services of the south Korean army and U.S. imperialist aggressor forces.
					
					 In another development, the south Korean warmongers kicked off Max Thunder joint air combat drill with the U.S. on October 25 and it will last till November 8.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun on Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a grave military provocation against the DPRK and a revelation of the undisguised scenario for preemptive nuclear attack on it.
					
					 The puppet forces would be well advised to look back upon what they have done in a bid to ignite a nuclear war against fellow countrymen with outside forces before vociferating about someone's "provocation of a local war and total war", a fiction.
					
					 They are posing ever-increasing threat of provocation and war to the DPRK. This is clearly evidenced by the saber-rattling now under way in south Korea. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that the danger of a nuclear war is escalating on the Korean Peninsula day by day and that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime are wholly to blame for this.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces should stop such foolish adventure as jumping into fire with faggot on their back.
					
					 They should think twice over the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their nuclear war drumbeat against the DPRK.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, Japanese Prime Minister Abe made an ornamental offering to Yasukuni Shrine on the occasion of the so-called great memorial service in the autumn season. At least 150 dietmen swarmed to the shrine to attend the service.
					 Despite the strong protest of Asian countries the Japanese reactionaries justified the visits, claiming that "it is natural to pay respects for those who laid down their lives for the sake of the country".
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is an insult to humankind and challenge to justice.
					
					 The important aim sought by the Japanese reactionaries through visits to the shrine is to paint the war dead allegedly "honored" by the shrine as "patriots" and bring back their souls in a bid to facilitate the moves for militarizing society and making it  veer to the Right and turning it reactionary.
					
					 The issue of the visit to the shrine is a crucial matter not only related to the peace in Asia but to the fate of Japan, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Japan is again taking the road of veering to the Right, oblivious of the lesson drawn from its past days. This situation today calls on the politicians and people of Japan to come to their senses.
					
					 Japan should not rush headlong into the veer to the Right for militarism but opt for settling its past. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better behave themselves, bearing in mind that there would be no future for not only the present Japanese regime but Japan unless it liquidates its past.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy toward Japan Accused
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy toward Japan Accused
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Recently, the south Korean puppet group has made no scruple of committing treacherous acts by inflaming Japan's wild ambition for territorial expansion.
					 On October 21 the south Korean puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs sent what it called secret guidelines to embassies in foreign countries. The guidelines said that those embassies may not call for the single notation of Tok Islets even if the islets are described as Tok islets and "Takeshima" at the same time.
					
					 This is a heinous act of sycophancy toward Japan, an act of fanning up Japan's wild ambition for reinvasion and revival of militarism as evidenced by its attempt to grab Tok Islets which are part of the inalienable territory of the Korean nation.
					
					 The successive puppet rulers of south Korea pursued sycophantic policy of depending on outside forces.
					
					 But there was no such precedent as the Park Geun Hye's group which fawned upon the master even over the territorial issue of the nation.
					
					 The Park's group is, indeed, made up of traitors who inherited the disposition of the "yusin" dictator who served Japan so faithfully as to earn a nickname "special class Japanese".
					
					 Now Japan has become evermore undisguised in its moves to realize the wild ambition to grab Tok Islets.
					
					 This year it newly formed an office in the Cabinet Secretariat, which is to exclusively deal with the issues related to the Tok Islets.
					
					 The Japanese foreign minister blustered south Korea is a companion of Japan and the issue of Takeshima is not what can be settled soon, so he will deal with it with patience.
					
					 Moreover, a Japanese diplomatic document that was approved at a cabinet ministerial meeting notes that "the islets are part of the inalienable territory of Japan in view of historical facts and international law", an indication of Japan's brigandish attitude.
					
					 In March last the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan examined and passed textbooks of geography and political economics, all of which specified Tok Islets as possession of Japan.
					
					 In July Japan published a defence white paper which also stipulated Tok Islets as "territory of Japan".
					
					 It instituted what it called "Day of Takeshima (Tok Islets)" and has annually staged farces to mark it since 2005. Japan has become all the more frantic in its moves to revive militarism and expand territory as evidenced by the visit to Yasukuni Shrine, publication of textbooks distorting history and beautifying its past wars of aggression.
					
					 Shortly ago, it went the lengths of posting on internet a video claiming the dominium over Tok Islets.
					
					 However, far from demanding an apology from Japan, the present ruling forces in south Korea are actively patronizing and encouraging Japan which has become ever-more undisguised in its arrogance and belligerency to realize the wild ambition for militarist revival and territorial expansion.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye's group, finding itself in the worst ruling crisis, is running amuck in its confrontation racket and war moves against the DPRK, while clinging to the coattails of its U.S. and Japanese masters.
					
					 This is evidenced by its recent joint military drills with Japan and the moves to tighten military cooperation with the latter.
					
					 The Park group should bear in mind that traitors bent on treachery and sycophancy clean indifferent to the dignity and sovereignty of the nation will only meet a miserable ruin.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Urged Not to Feign Ignorance: Paper
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Urged Not to Feign Ignorance: Paper
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on October 25 reported the ever-mounting worldwide criticism of the puppet presidential election.
					 Red herring operations made by the Intelligence Service, the Cyber Command under the Defense Ministry and the Patriots and Veterans Affairs Agency during the "presidential election" last year have been disclosed one after another, the paper said.
					
					 In this regard major media of the world accused Park Geun Hye of being elected through election rigging, commenting that this is paralyzing the south Korean politics and throwing its society into chaos, it noted.
					
					 Civic and public circles and scholars of various countries are also expressing concern over this, it said, and went on:
					
					 It is abnormal that Park Geun Hye is keeping mum about the case to which world public pays attention, or feigning ignorance. She can protect her face from sunrays with her palms but cannot conceal truth and conscience. She can neither blind tens of millions of people as they are eager to know truth nor gag billions of world people.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Struggle Waged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Struggle Waged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a rally at the plaza of Seoul Railway Station on October 26 to declare decisive resistance against the present authorities keen on evil deeds.
					 It was attended by at least 10,000 unionists under the KCTU.
					
					 Speeches were made at the rally.
					
					 Sin Sung Chol, chairman of the KCTU, termed the present regime threatening to stamp out the Teachers Union, the legitimate trade union, the regime violating democracy and suppressing labor.
					
					 The regime aims to oppress all the democratic trade unions in the wake of its suppression of the Teachers Union, he said, calling upon all organizations to turn out in the action to check the moves for cracking down on the trade union.
					
					 Ri Sang Mu, chairman of the Public Transport Trade Union, said that the commitments made by Park Geun Hye to push ahead with the privatization of railways, gas, electricity, medical care and other public sectors during the election campaign were false promises she made to realize her ambition to take power. He called for forcing the chief executive to step down as she does not work for the people and has no qualifications.
					
					 Kim Jong Hun, chairman of the Teachers Union, noted that the regime informed the union that it is not a trade union. This is little short of declaring the start of the second "yusin" dictatorship, he said, and went on: The regime is cracking down on the Teachers Union, not content with taking office through illegal operations. This is aimed to justify the May 16 military coup and intensify the moves to distort history designed to embellish the pro-Japanese acts and traitors.
					
					 Kim Jung Nam, chairman of the Government Employees Union, said that the Teachers Union is suppressed as the case is the same with the Government Employees Union. He expressed the will to settle the situation through solidarity actions of the workers.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Moving to Ban Progressive Paper
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Moving to Ban Progressive Paper
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Koreans in the U.S. including the U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. and the U.S. Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a joint statement on October 24 denounced the south Korean authorities for moving to ban a progressive paper.
					 The statement recalled that the south Korean conservative forces are trying to shut down Jaju Minbo, a progressive internet paper, which has made all efforts to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 This is reminiscent of the shuddering suppression of the media during the Park Chung-Hee's "yusin" dictatorship and the moves for forcible merger and shutdown of media organizations during the Chun Doo Hwan's military dictatorship, it said.
					
					 The moves for banning Jaju Minbo are an undemocratic act to violate the freedom of the press and stop the mouth, eye and ear of the people, it noted, adding it amounts to crackdown on all people aspiring after the north-south reconciliation, independence, peace and reunification.
					
					 The organizations of Koreans in the U.S will wage an action to defend Jaju Minbo together with the south Korean people, it said.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Korean Victims in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan Held
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Korean Victims in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan Held
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- A joint memorial service of compatriots in Kanagawa for Korean victims was held in Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan on October 20.
					 Present there were Ri Yong Hun, chairman of the Kanagawa Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), chairpersons of its various branches, compatriots and bereaved families.
					
					 Kim Yong Jae, vice-chairman of the Tsurumi Branch of Chongryon, made a memorial address.
					
					 He said that so many Koreans met grievous deaths not only in the great Kanto quake but also in military bases, munitions factories, mines and construction sites in Kanagawa Prefecture during the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 All the Chongryon officials and Koreans in the prefecture will never pardon the Japanese government, which has made desperate efforts to tamper with history and frantically pursued the hostile policy toward the DPRK while evading the responsibility for the past crimes even in the new century, he noted.
					
					 He declared that Koreans in Japan would carry on their actions until the Japanese government makes an apology and reparation for the past wrongdoings.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the victims.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Slam S. Korean Regime's Closure of Progressive Paper
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Slam S. Korean Regime's Closure of Progressive Paper
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany issued a joint statement on October 25 to denounce the south Korean puppet group for its moves to shut down a progressive paper.
					 The persistent and deliberate moves of the ultra-right conservative forces to shut down the paper Jaju Minbo as part of their campaign to suppress and stamp out thinking, conscience and freedom of expression are acts of trampling down justice and truth, the statement charged.
					
					 Their suppression of the media which conducted activities to keep the June 15 era of reunification alive is nothing but power's violence and an arrogant and self-righteous action, it held.
					
					 It urged the south Korean ruling forces to stop the anachronistic hunting of media.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Website by British Organization
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is a Juche-Type Revolutionary Party Which Inherited the Glorious Tradition of the DIU" on its website on Oct. 17.
					 The work, published on October 17, Juche 71(1982), clarifies the idea that the WPK is a Juche-type revolutionary party which explored a new way of its development and has conducted revolutionary activities independently and creatively, guided by the Juche idea.
					
					 It also clarifies the position and role of the WPK in accomplishing the socialist cause.

articles.title: Beninese National Committee for Remembering General Kim Jong Il Inaugurated
articles.content:
Beninese National Committee for Remembering General Kim Jong Il Inaugurated
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The Beninese National Committee for Remembering General Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Cotonou on October 23.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and chairman of the Beninese National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful events to widely introduce and disseminate the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 2nd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: British Organizations Call for Dismantlement of S. Korean IS
articles.content:
British Organizations Call for Dismantlement of S. Korean IS
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association released a joint statement on October 20 in denunciation of the conspiratorial moves of the south Korean authorities against the DPRK.
					 The statement accused the south Korean puppet Intelligence Service (IS) of resorting to foolish moves to tarnish the image of the DPRK.
					
					 It is, indeed, ridiculous for the IS, the most ferocious and hateful one in the world, to talk about "human rights," it noted, and went on:
					
					 The IS has been censured by the world people for such evil doings as brutally suppressing the patriotic struggle of people and abducting people in foreign countries.
					
					 The evermore undisguised anti-DPRK conspiratorial racket of the IS is aimed to hype the worth of its existence in a bid to calm down the daily growing voices calling for the IS's disbandment, help the puppet regime tide over its ruling crisis, escalate confrontation with the north and thus push the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase.
					
					 The statement called for immediately disbanding the IS and bringing down the Park Geun Hye fascist regime.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Lauded in Benin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Lauded in Benin
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", said Kim Jong Il's works serve as a library and encyclopedia for revolution and construction.
					 He, who is also chairman of the Beninese National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, made the remarks at the inaugural ceremony of the Beninese National Committee for Remembering General Kim Jong Il held on October 23.
					
					 Kim Jong Il steadily enriched the Juche idea through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities which involved all spheres of politics, economy, military affairs and culture, he said, and went on:
					
					 Everybody is greatly admired by his works for their philosophical contents and profound contents.
					
					 All his works are based on the Juche idea and give perfect answers to all theoretical and practical issues raised by the era and revolution.
					
					 I pay highest tribute to Kim Jong Il, a great master of thoughts and theories.

articles.title: U.S. Should Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK: World Public
articles.content:
U.S. Should Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK: World Public
 Pyongyang, October 29 (KCNA) -- World public is strongly demanding the U.S. roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and accept the DPRK's proposal for replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) with a peace treaty in order to ensure peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					 A Nepali paper said: 
					
					 The situation on the Korean Peninsula has reached the danger line amid acute confrontation. This is attributable to the moves of the hostile forces to stifle the DPRK and their provocative military drills against it. So, the tense situation is prevailing on the peninsula.
					
					 Dark clouds have lingered over the peninsula due to the military conflicts between the north and the south, the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises and their repeated politically-motivated provocation moves.
					
					 The Communist Youth Front of Italy in a statement noted:
					
					 The joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities are, needless to say, a wanton violation of the AA and a real threat to world peace.
					
					 The DPRK has long proposed signing a peace treaty with the U.S. but the latter refused to do so and has still stationed its armed forces for aggression in south Korea. The U.S. not only introduced huge nuclear weapons into south Korea but has steadily beefed up arms and equipment. The DPRK proposed the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula long ago but the U.S. has only unilaterally urged the DPRK to disarm itself.
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said that the AA has long lost its mission and role as a tool for reducing the tensions and the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula and that no one pins hope on it any more. He went on:
					
					 As long as the AA is left intact, peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in its vicinity can not be ensured and the independent and peaceful development of the Korean nation cannot be expected.
					
					 The DPRK has long raised the proposal for replacing the AA with a peace treaty and establishing a new and durable peace mechanism and made consistent and persistent efforts to carry it out. To replace the AA with a peace treaty is the first and foremost precondition for preventing the arms buildup and arms race on the peninsula and settling the relations between the north and the south and between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The Finnish paper Tyokansan Sanomat stated:
					
					 Recently the peace-loving DPRK proposed the U.S. again in the strong terms to replace the ceasefire with a peace mechanism in order to ensure durable peace on the Korean Peninsula. If the U.S truly wants peace and security on the peninsula, it should stop nuclear threat and war maneuvers against the other party with practical act, not just with words.
					
					 The U.S. should respond to the DPRK's proposal for signing a peace treaty as soon as possible.
					
					 The Jordanian paper Al Diyar said:
					
					 In fact, the leadership of the DPRK and the resolute counteraction of its combat-ready armed forces brought the U.S. to its knees before the Korean people. The U.S. is driven into a tight corner, becoming a laughing-stock of the world.
					
					 The DPRK is turning the moves of the aggressors into bubbles by dint of the war deterrence for self-defense.
					
					 The chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association said:
					
					 It is the disposition and the mode of countermeasure of the DPRK to return hard-line action with tougher one. Therefore, the U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, respect its sovereignty and settle all the issues through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 If the U.S. and its allies discard their hostile policy toward the DPRK and respect its sovereignty, the issue will soon see a settlement.

articles.title: Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il 
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, visito el dia 29 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan, sagrado lugar del Juche donde estan conservados los cuerpos de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					Le acompanaron en esta visita su esposa, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio, Luvsanvandan Bold, el embajador mongol en Corea Manibadrakh Ganbold, el ministro de Industria y Agricultura, Khaltmaa Battulga, el secretario del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional, Tsagaandari Enkhtuvshin, el jefe del Estado Mayor General de las Fuerzas Armadas, Tserendejid Byambajav, el viceministro de Transporte, Khabshai Erjan, el asesor del presidente para la Seguridad Nacional y la Politica Exterior, Lundeg Purevsuren, el asesor del presidente para el enlace con masas y la politica para masas, Amgalanbaatar Ganbaatar, el secretario de Estado del Ministerio de Cultura, Deportes y Turismo, Pureb Altangerel, y otras personalidades y los miembros de la sede diplomatica de Mongolia en Corea. 
					
					Les acompanaron el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el embajador coreano en Mongolia Hong Kyu y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					Ante las estatuas de pie de los Generalisimos, estaba de pie la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Ejercito Rojo Obrero-Campesino. 
					
					Alli fue colocado un cesto de flores a nombre del mandatario mongol. 
					
					El rindio el homenaje postumo a los Generalisimos y se dirigio a los halles de eternidad donde estan conservados los cuerpos de ellos quienes hicieron gran aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Mongolia y al cumplimiento de la causa de verificacion de la independencia en el mundo entero. 
					
					Paso revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes y las otras de carros, tren electrico, barco y trenes usados por los Generalisimos hasta el ultimo momento de su vida para las visitas de orientacion y el viaje al extranjero. 
					
					El visitante escribio en el libro de visitas que el Estado, gobierno y pueblo de Mongolia aprecian mucho las proezas de Su Excelencia Kim Il Sung y Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, grandes lideres del pueblo coreano quienes hicieron valiosa contribucion al desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises, prepararon y fortalecieron la base de esos vinculos. Igualmente, expuso la conviccion de que bajo la guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, el pueblo coreano reunificara la patria de manera pacifica y cumplira con exito las tareas para la prosperidad del pais y la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo, en acato al legado de los grandes lideres.

articles.title: Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj visita a Phanmunjom
articles.content:
Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj visita a Phanmunjom 
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, y su comitiva visitaron este martes a Phanmunjom.
					Los huespedes vieron la lapida con la ultima firma que dejo en su vida el Presidente Kim Il Sung al pie del documento historico que trataba los asuntos para eliminar la tragedia de division nacional y cumplir la causa de reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					Escuchando explicaciones de que bajo la sabia orientacion del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, el ejercito y pueblo coreanos lograron victoria fulminante en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria al rechazar la invasion armada de las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas, ellos pasaron revista a las salas de negociaciones de armisticio y de firma del Acuerdo de Armisticio, el Pabellon Phanmun y otros lugares. 
					
					Los huespedes visitaron tambien la tumba del rey Kongmin. 
					
					El mismo dia, el mandatario y su comitiva fueron invitados al banquete ofrecido por el Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Kaesong. 
					
					Con anterioridad, el visitante pronuncio un discurso en el encuentro entre los empresarios mongoles y los funcionarios economicos coreanos, realizado en el Hotel Internacional Yanggakdo.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de PTC hacia Mexico y Brasil
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de PTC hacia Mexico y Brasil
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea presidida por el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Pak Kun Gwang, partio el dia 29 de esta capital para visitar Mexico y tomar parte en el 13o Congreso del Partido Comunista Brasileno que se efectuara en Sao Paulo de Brasil.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de UMDC hacia Brasil
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de UMDC hacia Brasil
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- La delegacion de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea presidida por la vicepresidenta Chae Chun Hui, partio el dia 29 de esta capital para tomar parte en la reunion del Secretariado de la Federacion Democratica Internacional de Mujeres y en el seminario internacional que tendran lugar en Brasil.

articles.title: 24o concurso nacional y exhibicion de programas
articles.content:
24o concurso nacional y exhibicion de programas
Pyongyang, 29 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedaron inaugurados el dia 29 el 24o concurso nacional y exhibicion de programas. 
					En la ocasion se presentaron mas de mil 200 programas desarrollados por los cientificos y tecnicos.
					
					Figuran los programas de mando, aparatos y accesorios presentados por varios dominios de la economia nacional, entre otros, la industria carbonifera, la electrica, la metalurgica, el transporte ferroviario, la agricultura y la industria ligera. 
					
					Tambien se ven los programas de deportes a ser contribuidos a la construccion de la potencia deportiva. 
					
					Hay datos que demuestran el nivel cibernetico de los ministerios, organos centrales, fabricas y empresas, y programas desarrollados por los profesores, investigadores y estudiantes de los institutos superiores, escuelas politecnicas y bases de formacion de talentosos de la rama cibernetica. 
					
					En el marco del certamen que se realiza dividido en 18 secciones tendran lugar los concursos de programas de traduccion del idioma ingles-coreano y el chino-coreano, los de programas de analisis de competencias deportivas, etc. 
					
					Tuvo lugar la ceremonia de inauguracion en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones con la participacion del secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, funcionarios correspondientes e inventores de programas. 
					
					El presidente del Comite Estatal de Ciencias y Tecnicas, Choe Sang Gon, hizo uso de la palabra de apertura.
